updateData.functionBody: return 3 * Math.floor(rowIndex / 3) + Math.floor(columnIndex / 3);
return 3 * (rowIndex % 3) + (columnIndex % 3);
return 3 * Math.floor(rowIndex / 3) + Math.floor(columnIndex / 3);
return 3 * (rowIndex % 3) + (columnIndex % 3);
return (historyForRevert.currentEntry > 0);

content.text: Sudoku Helper
This workspace is an aid for playing sudoku. It determines which squares are ruled out based on the other entries in a given row, column or section of the board.
TO DO:
I need to clean up after my history changes
My history supports "redo" but I don't have it. I should add it.
I added a place to flag a bad board from selections. I need to do something with this and clear it when appropriate
it doesn't solve evil. We need another level for the updated to do that. (an evil game was pasted in)
later, sudoku generator, made into a server, with selectable difficulty level (related to solver level used)
later, sudoku helper with selectable level of help, made into an app
history is in, but I commented the message to update because it can not be cleared. We need the ui to control that.
source of boards:
https://www.websudoku.com/?level=4
(well, level 4 is the hardest option)
Form
Settings Info
Game Board
This is the game board that should be edited.
Allowed Moves

This board contains the allowed moves for each square, based on the other values present in the given row, column and section. We use the function getAllowedSquareValues to find the value for each square that does not have a selection in it.
Processing
This data cell contains the allowed moves for each cell.
In the following table we just make a copy of the game board, verifying the input in the process.
These are the legal selections:
Here we have a folder function to find the allowed values for a specific square given the current game board.
Updater
Here we add a cell that will check for squares that only have one option. It will then use the messenger to update the active game board to include these single options.
Selection Finder Methods
This is the "level 1" function used to find a selection for a square. It simply chooses the option if it is the only option available.
This is the "level 2" function to find a selection for a square. It chooses an option if this square is the only member of a row, column or section to hold that option.
Updater Utilities
Below are some utilities used in the updater code
This is a constant used within the updated to indicate no known selection for a square.
This is a constant used within the updater to indicate no valid selection for a square.

This function is is used where there are multiple attempts to find the selection. If more than one comes up with an answer the better agree or there is a problem on the board. This function merges new selections in to the current selection.
History
getAllowedSquareValues
This page function finds the allowed values for a gameboard square given the square row and column and the game board data.
Inputs
This is the row index for the working square.
This is the column index for the working square.
This is the game board data.
Processing
Section Info
The following functions deal with sections. That is what I am calling a 3x3 section of the board. There may be a proper name for this, but I don't know much about sudoku so I am going with this.

The naming conventions I am using is section number refers to the 3x3 square from the game board and section index refers to the sqaure within the section. The numbering/indexing starts at the top left (with 0) and increases by one as you go horizontally.
Below are the section number and section index for the current active square.
Selections
The following are the selections on the game board in the active row, excluding the current square.
The following are the selections on the game board in the active column, excluding the current square.
The following are the selections on the game board in the active section, excluding the current square.
Return Value
Here we calculate what values are allowed for a cell given the current game board data. This is also the return value.
xx
Game Boards
This page contains a list of game boards that can be played.

Below are the section number and section index for the current active square.
